body:
What Type? 
`Master/Slave` almost without any reduce.
`sharding tables` seem half speed of raw insert.

without any reduce

my sharding config：
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15796879/67944782-3e879b80-fc18-11e9-95bb-1493fa8eb8e0.png)

the same configuration.  
`Raw Insert` insert 10,000 rows data use 1.759s
`Sharding table` insert 10,000 rows data use  10.42s

Hi, We have made some progress in the configuration after discussion.
The new configuration in the plan is as follows.
```yml
spring:
    shardingsphere:
        orchestration:
            name: ''
            overwrite: ''
            registry:
                digest: ''
                max-retries: ''
                name: '#Orchestration instance name'
                namespace: ''
                operation-timeout-milliseconds: ''
                props: ''
                retry-interval-milliseconds: ''
                server-lists: ''
                time-to-live-seconds: ''
                type: '#Example:zookeeper,nacos,apollo'
            config:
                digest: ''
                max-retries: ''
                name: '#Orchestration instance name'
                namespace: ''
                operation-timeout-milliseconds: ''
                overwrite: ''
                props: ''
                retry-interval-milliseconds: ''
                server-lists: ''
                time-to-live-seconds: ''
                type: '#Example:zookeeper,nacos,apollo'
            leaf:
                digest: ''
                max-retries: ''
                name: '#Orchestration instance name'
                namespace: ''
                operation-timeout-milliseconds: ''
                props: ''
                retry-interval-milliseconds: ''
                server-lists: ''
                time-to-live-seconds: ''
                type: '#Example:zookeeper,nacos,apollo'
```
The old configuration is as follows.
```yml
spring:
    shardingsphere:
        orchestration:
            name: ''
            overwrite: ''
            registry:
                digest: ''
                max-retries: ''
                namespace: ''
                operation-timeout-milliseconds: ''
                props: ''
                retry-interval-milliseconds: ''
                server-lists: ''
                time-to-live-seconds: ''
                type: ''
                use-for: '#'
```

We hope that the new configuration can be compatible with the old configuration, but we want the configuration to be non redundant. There are some difficulties we get, can you give me some advice ?

1. For compatibility with old configuration, ConfigCenter and LeafCenter must be optional. Can we use RegistryCenter to do the job of ConfigCenter or LeafCenter When user don't config ConfigCenter or LeafCenter ?

2. There are `orchestration`'s child `name` in old configuration. Can we keep the `orchestration.name` and add `orchestration.registry.name` `orchestration.config.name` `orchestration.leaf.name` ?

We're very confused about this, Looking forward to your advice.
`overwrite` is only for config. `orchestration.overwrite` will be overlap?
duplicate with #3351
Can you change title for search friendly?

what about this? but `overwrite` is still redundant.


This plan！
At present,ConfigCenter and LeafCenter must be optional.we use RegistryCenter to do the job of ConfigCenter or LeafCenter When user don't config ConfigCenter or LeafCenter .
In this way, there will be a problem,the functions that can be realized by zookeeper RegistryCenter , but Nacos RegistryCenter  can't realize such functions!

> `Raw Insert` insert 10,000 rows data use 1.759s
> `Sharding table` insert 10,000 rows data use 10.42s

I found sharding table insert 10000 rows in one sql slower than 500 rows in 20 sql，because sql longer parsing sql slower？
It's all my fault. I am so careless that add a more '}' in my sharding config file.

@yanickxia  We need talk about this pull request in the issue first. I don't get the point to change source code, it maybe doesn't make sense.
This is the internal implementation. I suggest your coding don't depend on it, the refactor always occur for internal implementation without guarantee.

I suggest do not change it because of the `SimpleQueryShardingEngine` can lazy initialized. If user create statement, but do not call execute create `SimpleQueryShardingEngine` instance is unnecessary. 

So what is the actual benefit to refactor this?

Hi @huangjian888 , Thanks for you contribution.

For nacos as a ConfigCenter, I think it is not very important, because the ConfigCenter and RegistryCenter interface's definition doesn’t finish finally. 
I think we should discuss the final interface's definition, and refactor the ConfigCenter and RegistryCenter. You can participate in this work.

@wgy8283335 , @sunbufu and me are discussing this work in github issue( #3185 ) and WeChat group, you can submit your suggestion, if you aren't in WeChat group, I can invite you to it and discuss this work.

Do you think this is a good way?

Hi, can you change the title for search friendly?
We can open this issue and let volunteer to consider about it.

please fill in the issue template as follow. Thanks.

Bug Report
For English only, other languages will not accept.

Before report a bug, make sure you have:

Searched open and closed GitHub issues.
Read documentation: ShardingSphere Doc.
Please pay attention on issues you submitted, because we maybe need more details.
If no response more than 7 days and we cannot reproduce it on current information, we will close it.

Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

Which version of ShardingSphere did you use?
Which project did you use? Sharding-JDBC or Sharding-Proxy?
Expected behavior
Actual behavior
Reason analyze (If you can)
Steps to reproduce the behavior, such as: SQL to execute, sharding rule configuration, when exception occur etc.

I have some problems: @terrymanu 
1.when the subquery's TableReferencesContext shoule be extracted,SubqueryPredicateExtractor or TableReferencesExtractor ?
2. where the subquery's TableReferencesContext should be saved,it can be used when ShardingRouter.route

WhereClauseShardingConditionEngine.createShardingConditions

tablesContext shoule use subquery's tablesContext
3.the sql"SELECT * FROM t_order_item WHERE status IN (SELECT status FROM t_order WHERE user_id = 10 AND order_id = 1000)" how to route,by subtable[t_order],or maintable [t_order_item] or [t_order] and [t_order_item] 

thank you!

I am Chinese, English is not very good.



Sharding-jdbc JDBC latest version

Mybatisplus latest version



## problem

The page method of the mybatisplus Page object accepts a long argument.
And sharding-jdbc receives the int type

In source
Package org.apache.shardingsphere.core.optimize.sharding.segment.select.pagination;
getValue method convert to int
Throw a conversion exception

## recurrent
Use the MybatisPlus Page object to page through the query to reproduce

## hope
Integrated mybatisplus compatible
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
If no update, I will close this issue soon.
I just set this issue as invalid until title change. And I will close later if title do not change.

I've changed it.soryy!!!

```
spring:

            testname1:
                center-type: registry_center,leaf_center
                instance-type: zookeeper
                server-lists: 192.178.32.45:9001,192.178.32.45:9002,192.178.32.45:9003
                namespace: testnamspace1
                props: 
		  overwrite: false
                  retry-interval-milliseconds: 10
                  time-to-live-seconds: 10
```

@jinjim Can you follow @yanickxia 's suggestion and try it?

1. First Step
- modify sharding-orchestration-config, includes: interfaces, configuration, implementation.
- add sharding-orchestration-distributed-lock, includes: interfaces, configuration, implementation.
- modify sharding-orchestration-reg, include: configuration.and modify sharding-orchestration-core, include: initialization related.

2. Second Step
- add sharding-orchestration-instance. This module is for the implementation of reg, lock, config.
- modify sharding-orchestration-reg and delete implementations.
- sharding-orchestration-core modify initialization related.

3. Third Step
- modify registry center interface
- modify caller with config.
- modify caller with distributed lock.
- modify caller with reg. 
- sharding-orchestration-core modify initialization related.
